content.rendered:
Our doctors are here for you.

Maple connects you to a doctor in minutes, anytime 24/7, so you can start feeling better, faster.

Meet some of our doctors.

Our physicians are Canadian licensed and practice family or emergency medicine right here in Canada.

Family Physician Toronto
Dr. Michael Verbora
Dr. Verbora practices family medicine in Toronto, and specializes in student health. He received his Bachelor of Science with Honours from the University of Windsor, his Masters of Business Administration from Odette School of …

Dr. Verbora practices family medicine in Toronto, and specializes in student health. He received his Bachelor of Science with Honours from the University of Windsor, his Masters of Business Administration from Odette School of Business, and his Doctor of Medicine from the University of Western Ontario. Dr. Verbora completed specialty training at the Toronto Western Hospital, while acting as the OCFP (Ontario College of Family Physicians) Chair of the Residents Committee.

Family & Urgent Care Calgary
Dr. Gita Kruger
Dr. Gita Kruger is a practicing family medicine and urgent care physician in Calgary, Alberta. Her pre-medical education includes Masters of Science (MSc) degrees in both Audiology and Speech Pathology from Syracuse University …

Dr. Gita Kruger is a practicing family medicine and urgent care physician in Calgary, Alberta. Her pre-medical education includes Masters of Science (MSc) degrees in both Audiology and Speech Pathology from Syracuse University. She then completed her Doctor of Medicine at McMaster University and completed her residency training at the University of Calgary. Dr. Kruger has a strong interest in the Canadian health care system with respect to the Canada Health Act, access to care and wait times. She looks forward to providing quality and timely care to patients in Alberta and all over Canada.

Family Physician Charlottetown
Dr. Garth Slysz
Dr. Slysz has practiced as a family physician in Charlottetown in PEI for 26 years. Throughout that time he has cared for his patients in the Queen Elizabeth Hospital. He has taught family medicine residents and medical studen …

Dr. Slysz has practiced as a family physician in Charlottetown in PEI for 26 years. Throughout that time he has cared for his patients in the Queen Elizabeth Hospital. He has taught family medicine residents and medical students and he has worked in the ER and as a hospitalist. He is a graduate of Mt. Allison University and Dalhousie Medical School. In 2016 he received the College of Family Physicians of Canada Reg L. Perkin Award for Canada’s 2016 Family Physicians of the Year.

Family Physician Mississauga
Dr. Aleksandra Ferenc
Dr. Ferenc is a practicing family physician in Mississauga, who speaks both English and Polish. She received her Bachelor of Science from Queen’s University and her Doctor of Medicine from Jagiellonian University Medical Colle …

Dr. Ferenc is a practicing family physician in Mississauga, who speaks both English and Polish. She received her Bachelor of Science from Queen’s University and her Doctor of Medicine from Jagiellonian University Medical College in Cracow, Poland. She completed her residency at East Carolina University in North Carolina in the United States. Dr. Ferenc also trained in the UK and believes that Canadians should have access to the best quality patient care seen in other countries around the world. Having two young children of her own helps Dr. Ferenc relate to her paediatric patients and their parents, and she is passionate about how nutrition affects health in patients of all ages.

Family & ER Physician Toronto
Dr. Eric Fonberg
Dr. Fonberg is a family and emergency physician with more than 30 years of experience practicing primary care and hospital based medicine. He received his Doctor of Medicine from Western University, and his Master of Public He …

Dr. Fonberg is a family and emergency physician with more than 30 years of experience practicing primary care and hospital based medicine. He received his Doctor of Medicine from Western University, and his Master of Public Health from Harvard University. Throughout his career, Dr. Fonberg has practiced medicine in a variety of settings in urban and rural communities in Ontario and Canada’s Arctic, and has been Chief of Emergency Medicine and Chief of Staff at numerous hospitals in Toronto. He is a lecturer at the University of Toronto Faculty of Medicine.

ER Physician Toronto
Dr. Mark D’Souza
Dr. D’Souza is a practicing emergency room physician in Toronto, with extensive experience in both adult and paediatric medicine. He received his Bachelor of Arts & Science from McMaster University, and his Doctor of Medic …

Dr. D’Souza is a practicing emergency room physician in Toronto, with extensive experience in both adult and paediatric medicine. He received his Bachelor of Arts & Science from McMaster University, and his Doctor of Medicine from Queen’s University. He completed his specialty training at the University of Western Ontario and his fellowship at the University of Manitoba. Dr. D’Souza has experience as well in palliative care and chronic pain.

ER Physician Toronto
Dr. Shafik Dharamshi
Dr. Dharamshi has been a staff physician in the emergency departments of the Scarborough Hospital and Rouge Valley Health System for the past 27 years. He obtained his Bachelor of Science degree from McMaster University, and h …

Dr. Dharamshi has been a staff physician in the emergency departments of the Scarborough Hospital and Rouge Valley Health System for the past 27 years. He obtained his Bachelor of Science degree from McMaster University, and his Doctor of Medicine from the University of Toronto. He obtained specialty training in Emergency Medicine and Sports and Rehabilitation Medicine, and is a clinical instructor and lecturer at the University of Toronto Faculty of Medicine. Dr. Dharamshi enjoys the challenges of taking care of patients with a wide variety of clinical problems, and is a strong advocate for excellent and timely healthcare.

Family Physician Toronto
Dr. Marni Brooks
Dr. Brooks is a practicing family physician in Ontario. She received her Bachelor of Science degree at McGill University where she wrote her thesis in the area of paediatric pain. Dr. Brooks completed both a Master of Social W …

Dr. Brooks is a practicing family physician in Ontario. She received her Bachelor of Science degree at McGill University where she wrote her thesis in the area of paediatric pain. Dr. Brooks completed both a Master of Social Work degree and a Doctor of Medicine degree at the University of Toronto. She completed specialty training at the University of Toronto. She is also an active member at the Ontario Medical Association, serving on the Executive for the Section on Addiction Medicine.

ER Physician Toronto
Dr. Bharat Bahl
Dr. Bahl is a practicing emergency physician in the city of Toronto. He completed his Doctor of Medicine and Family Medicine training from the University of Toronto. He then obtained his speciality training in Emergency Medici …

Dr. Bahl is a practicing emergency physician in the city of Toronto. He completed his Doctor of Medicine and Family Medicine training from the University of Toronto. He then obtained his speciality training in Emergency Medicine from the University of Ottawa. During his training Dr. Bahl won awards for both teaching and research. His current passions include providing high quality patient care, teaching the next generation of physicians and improving the quality of care provided in Emergency Departments.

Treatable conditions

Acute care

Our doctors see and treat many common medical issues on Maple.

Some examples include:

  • Biliary colic/ Gallbladder attack
  • Bites & stings
  • Blepharitis
  • Body aches
  • Bronchitis
  • Cellulitis
  • Cough
  • Cold
  • Cold Sores
  • Constipation
  • Croup
  • Cystitis
  • Dehydration
  • Diarrhea
  • Diverticulitis
  • Earache
  • Fever
  • Frostbite
  • Flu (Influenza)
  • Food poisoning
  • Gallstones
  • Gout
  • Headache
  • Hemorrhoids
  • Hiatal Hernia
  • Hives
  • Hypoglycemia
  • Impetigo
  • Kidney infection
  • Kidney stones
  • Laryngitis
  • Lice
  • Lupus
  • Migraines
  • Mononucleosis
  • Mumps
  • Nail infections
  • Nasal congestion
  • Nausea & vomiting
  • Norovirus
  • Oral Thrush
  • Peptic ulcer
  • Pink eye
  • Pinworm
  • Pneumonia
  • Rashes
  • Respiratory infections
  • Ringworm
  • Rotavirus
  • Scabies
  • Shingles
  • Sinus infections
  • Sore throat
  • Sprains & minor injuries
  • Stomach Flu
  • Strep throat
  • Stye
  • Tonsillitis
  • Tuberculosis
  • Uterine Fibroids
  • Whooping cough
  • and more…
Chronic care

Doctors are available 24/7 to provide advice and prescriptions for common chronic care conditions.

Some examples include:

  • Acne
  • Allergies
  • Anemia
  • Asthma
  • Atopic Dermatitis
  • Bladder Cancer
  • Breast Cancer
  • Bulimia
  • Cancer
  • Cervical Cancer
  • Chronic Fatigue Syndrome
  • Chronic Nonallergic Rhinitis
  • Contact Dermatitis
  • COPD
  • Crohn’s Disease
  • Diabetes
  • Dyshidrotic Eczema
  • Eating Disorders
  • Eczema
  • Fibromyalgia
  • Gastritis
  • Hay Fever
  • Heart Failure
  • High blood pressure
  • High cholesterol
  • Hyperthyroidism
  • Hypothyroidism
  • Insomnia
  • Iron Deficiency
  • Irritable Bowel Syndrome
  • Lichen Planus
  • Menopause
  • Nummular Dermatitis
  • Obesity
  • Osteoarthritis
  • Pigment disorders
  • Plantar fasciitis
  • Rheumatoid arthritis
  • Rosacea
  • Sleep apnea
  • Snoring
  • Stasis Dermatitis
  • Stress management
  • Turner syndrome
  • Ulcerative Colitis
  • and more…
Mental health

Our doctors are available to provide advice and treatment for common mental health conditions.

Some examples include:

  • Anxiety
  • Addiction
  • Depression
  • Mental health
  • Mood changes
  • OCD
  • Panic attack
  • PTSD
  • Seasonal affective disorder
  • Trauma & loss
  • and more…
Women’s & Men’s health

Doctors can advise on family planning and treat conditions like urinary tract infections and erectile dysfunction.

Some examples include:

  • Bacterial vaginosis
  • Birth control prescriptions
  • Bladder Infection
  • Chlamydia
  • Crabs (Pubic lice)
  • Erectile Dysfunction
  • Genital Herpes
  • Genital Warts
  • Gonorrhea
  • Hair loss (alopecia)
  • HIV
  • HPV
  • Hypoactive sexual desire disorder
  • Premature ejaculation
  • Premenstrual issues
  • Sexually transmitted infections (STI’s)
  • Syphilis
  • Trichomoniasis
  • Urinary tract infections
  • Vaginitis
  • Yeast infections
  • and more…

What our doctors can do for you

Medical advice

Maple connects you with a licensed physician quickly, so you can get the help or advice you need and move on with your day.

Our doctors are well respected, Canadian licensed family or emergency medicine practitioners passionate about delivering outstanding healthcare.

Prescriptions

Doctors can give you a prescription at their discretion, based on your consultation.

Prescriptions on Maple are digital, and we send them to the pharmacy of your choice for fulfillment.

We can even have them delivered to your door in most cases, at no additional cost to you.

Learn more
Medical notes

Doctors can provide sick notes for school or work for short absences, so you can focus on resting instead of sitting in a waiting room.

They can also provide notes for therapist treatments, like a note for a chiropractor or registered massage therapist.

Learn more
Lab work

Doctors can order lab work and give you a lab work requisition. Currently available in all provinces.

Specialist referrals are available for select corporate partners only. We’re working on expanding the availability of these services for everyone, so please check back with us regularly if you’re looking for referrals from Maple.

Learn more

What our doctors cannot do

Medical emergencies

Maple is not intended for medical emergencies. If you believe you are experiencing an emergency, please call 911 or proceed to your nearest emergency room.

Some examples include:

  • Chest pain
  • Difficulty breathing
  • Suicidal thoughts
  • Major trauma
  • Gastrointestinal bleeding
Controlled medications

Our doctors cannot prescribe controlled medications such as narcotics.

Some examples include:

  • Narcotics, such as oxycodone, sold under brand names such as Percocet and OxyContin
  • Benzodiazepine medication such as Lorazepam, sold under brand name Ativan and others
  • Stimulant medications to treat ADHD such as brand names Ritalin, Adderall and Vyvanse
Disability & school forms

Doctors cannot fill out WSIB or specialty disability forms, such as school absence forms.

These forms tend to be complex, and require an in person doctor visit.

Sick notes that are backdated, or for longer absences

Doctors cannot provide sick notes for an illness that occurred in the distant past (i.e. more than a week ago).

Sick notes for absences greater than a week cannot be provided, either.

  • Hi Sandra, here’s the treatment I’m recommending for you:

    Dr. Palmer

  • Diagnosis for Sandra: Urinary Tract Infection
  • Dr. Palmer has written you
    a prescription: Macrobid 100 mg, 2 times daily for 7 days Accept prescription Decline

See how it works.

Instantly connect with Canadian doctors for online medical care from your phone, tablet or computer.

Learn more

Get started today.

Maple revolves around your needs and schedule. Start enjoying on demand healthcare that fits your life.

Get started

Work with us.

Become a provider
